elements.title: Diego Mateo Zapata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Spanish Inquisition sentenced Diego Mateo Zapata (pictured) to wear the sanbenito, receive 200 lashes, have his 600 books confiscated, and be exiled, despite being acquitted?

elements.title: Gento (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that SB19 became the first Filipino group to appear on Billboard's World Digital Song Sales chart, with "Gento"?

elements.title: Bill Putnam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bill Putnam was an All-American and the co-captain of the first UCLA team to win a basketball championship?

elements.title: Hotel Wolcott (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Hotel Wolcott had to be sold less than a year after it opened?

elements.title: Ester Sokler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ester Sokler has claimed that he has often been mistaken for a woman?

elements.title: siege of Landau (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the commander of the French garrison at the 1704 siege of Landau was blinded by an Allied artillery bombardment?

elements.title: Ikmal Jaya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ikmal Jaya, a former mayor of Tegal, Indonesia, published a translated Quran written in Pegon script while in prison?

elements.title: plans to fight (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Elon Musk plans to fight Mark Zuckerberg by lying on top of him?
